definition: lit. kill one to warn a hundred (idiom); to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: Said to be beheaded, will execute one as a warning to others.
sentences.chinese: 斬了，就會說成是殺一儆百。

sentences.english: The American authorities decided to let Lehman fail pour encourager les autres.
sentences.chinese: 美國當局決定殺一儆百讓雷曼兄弟倒臺。

sentences.english: Kill a man to warn a hundred is a necessary way to reduce crimes.
sentences.chinese: 殺一儆百是減少犯罪行爲的必要手段。

sentences.english: The boss decided to fire him to make an example of him to the other employees.
sentences.chinese: 老闆打算解僱他，以對其他員工殺一儆百。
